metadata.title: CVE-2019-9924 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
rbash in Bash before 4.4-beta2 did not prevent the shell user frommodifying BASH_CMDS, thus allowing the user to execute any command with thepermissions of the shell.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bash - 4.3-7ubuntu1.8+esm1
bash-builtins - 4.3-7ubuntu1.8+esm1
bash-static - 4.3-7ubuntu1.8+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bash package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3-7ubuntu1.8+esm1').
